intro: Quamoclit coccinea var. luteola, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
